Ulvryn Hamdarakh was the Sage of Saelmur, active circa 1284 DR.
In the , Ulvryn Hamdarakh penned and published a collection of ruminations on the topic of mortality, aptly titled Musings on Mortality. In the book, Ulvryn conceded his thought to a simple point whatever the purpose of life was, it was of great amusement to the gods.
